title.rendered: How to Know Your Car is On Its Last Leg

content.rendered:
The more you drive the car, the more you form a personal attachment to it. But hundreds of thousands of miles and everyday wear-and-tear build up and take a toll on the life of your car. We understand that cars are expensive, and you want to get as much out of them as you can, but at some point, it’s time to throw in the towel. As collectors of Chicago junk cars, we’ve come to know the signs your car is on its last leg.

You’re Constantly Buying New Parts

At some point, continuing to spend money on parts simply doesn’t make sense anymore. There’s a fine line between investing in your car in order to extend its life, but if the spending on auto parts becomes excessive, it may be time to consider getting rid of it.

You Constantly Need More Oil

If there’s a pool of oil underneath the front of your car every time you get in to drive somewhere, that’s a big red flag. This is especially true if you find yourself constantly going in to get your oil checked when there are no visible signs of oil leakage. This could be a sign the engine isn’t tight anymore, or the valve seals aren’t holding the oil anymore.

Strange Sounds Come from Your Engine

Cars have the tendency to make noises, and most of these sounds are normal. But if you notice a weird noise coming from the inside of your engine block, this isn’t a good sign as it will be expensive to fix.
Realizing you need a new car can be frustrating, but at Aero Auto Parts, we can soften the blow by giving you money for your Chicago junk car. If you think your car is soon going to die, contact us to see how much money you can get for your car. We will gladly help you through the entire car-selling process.
Source: KSAT
